title: Save to pocket extension missing - can't save anything
content:
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-save-pocket-extension-google-chrome - references an extension in the Google chrome store which doesn't exist. It used to be here chrome-extension://niloccemoadcdkdjlinkgdfekeahmflj

How do I get the right click "save to pocket" and the button on my extensions bar to save articles to pocket?

Because at present I have no functionality to add links to pocket.

The page here https://getpocket.com/add shows an alternative method which doesn't work either The "connect" button returns a 404 error; https://getpocket.com/apps/link/pocket-chrome?s=ADD_PAGE&ep=1

and the drag the bookmarklet to the bookmarks bar adds something to the bookmarks bar but when clicked does nothing as my list of saved articles hasn't changed

Without the ability to save pages to pocket, it does make the whole pocket app rather redundant. What's happening to address this?

title: Mozilla Firefox 115.18.0esr upgrade notice for 14th March but now disappeared
content: My company relies on another company for our VM using Amazon Linux 2 and installs Firefox ESR from Amazon Linux 2 extras. We have 115.18.0esr and were getting notifications at the top of Firefox saying this would stop working on 14th March. We got 128.7.0esr but it core dumped on loading even in safe mode and when creating a new profile. So downgraded and then found another coworker faced same issue so go him to also downgrade. I then went to recreate my issue get logs and screenshots to provide to my supplier but 128.7.0esr has disappeared from the amazon linux yum repo and the notification about the need to upgrade before 14th March has also gone and gone from co worker machines. I think it was needed for plugin and cert issues but I am not sure. I realise I should reach out to the supplier for them to then contact Amazon and find out what the issues are from their yum repo and see if it is anything to do with their provided vm. But has anyone got any info on the reason to upgrade from 115.18.0esr so I can add to the issue? I know it's EOL but the message was specific and came from Firefox and links which took you to info about why it was needed but it seems weird the notification has disappeared.

title: “command + click” opens two tabs instead of one
content:
Hi everyone,

I've been experiencing an issue with Firefox recently. When I use "Command + Left Click" to open a link in a new tab, it sometimes opens two identical tabs instead of one. Interestingly, this doesn't happen on all websites—it seems to occur mainly when using search engines, such as when clicking on search results. This problem doesn't occur in other browsers like Safari or Chrome.

Could this be due to a setting in Firefox, or is there another possible cause? Any advice on how to troubleshoot and resolve this would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

title: Accesso a google con impronta
content:
Buongiorno, fino a qualche mese fa, quando mi collegato da pc tramite browser Mozzilla Firefox al mio account google, mi bastava inserire il nome utente e mi arrivava la notifica sul telefono , dove inserivo l'impronta e mi collegava in automatico. Da qualche tempo ciò non avviene. Inserisco il nome utente google e mi chiede la password, se clicco su " accedi con altri metodi" metto passkey, e firefox mi chiede di inserire una chiave fisica nella usb (??) .

Cosa può esere successo? dal mio account google direi che è tutto a posto, l'accesso con impronta è abilitato.

resto in attesa grazie

title: Firefox View - searching through open tabs
content:
In the Firefox View tab, we can search for Open Tabs. I am wondering how I can make a strict search for a particular pattern. For example, let's say I have hundreds of tab open for youtube like below:

https://youtube.com/watch?v=<random> https://youtube.com/watch?v=<random> https://youtube.com/watch?v=<random> https://youtube.com <---------------------I want this one to appear in my search

how can I ONLY search for open tabs that is the youtube front page (i.e to not match anything after the ".com"). If I just search for "youtube.com", it will match all of them, but I only want the front page.

Then, i can quickly close all of the duplicate
creator: magicdog.dev

title: Recovering Passwords from logins.json.corrupt
content: Recently, I realized I haven't been logged into Firefox for the greater part of a year, and did so recently. I did so to sync my passwords with the cloud to restore in case something bad were to happen. Lo and behold, 2 days before doing this, my logins file corrupted. Attempting to open the .json in Firefox displays "unexpected character at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data". This file is pretty sizeable at 105 KB, so the info is on there, but I clearly cannot access it. I've also tried simply deleting the .corrupt extension and restarting Firefox, but it just instantly re-corrupts. Is there anyway to get my data back? Any advice is appreciated.
creator: bearhere7
